intro: Linanthus nuttallii subsp. floribundus, commonly known as the showy linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The subspecies floribundus is distinguished by its profuse flowering and compact growth habit. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
